item.title: FORWARD DMV Showcase : The Loft is Back!
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Were thrilled to announce that our FORWARD DMV Showcase this Friday, April 11th is going to take place at Union Arts DC, otherwise known as the 411 Loft!

411 New York Ave NE DC

    Its been impossible finding a venue that has the same intimate atmosphere and cozy vibe that the Loft provided us for so many years. We figured we would just stop searching and do whatever it takes to get back to our favorite spot in DC. THE WAIT IS OVER, FORWARD FAMILY! We cant begin to express how excited we are for this Friday. Bring your dancing shoes and dont plan on going home til LATE.
Each year, before FORWARD kicks off we host a locals showcase. Locals are the foundation of our community. They inspire us, propel our scene, get and keep the party going. On this special night, were happy to be hosting a grip of locals that are all doing proper things in pushing our scene FORWARD and broadening our perspective on dance music.
FRIDAY.APRIL.11.2014 | 21+ | 10PM - LATE | $10 *FREE for FORWARD Pass Holders* http://www.forwarddc.com/passes.html Dont Miss Out on Any of the Official FORWARD 2014 Preview Events

item.title: Forward Preview Event: Amir Alexander
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
FORWARD Preview Event Announcement:A Tribute to Frankie Knuckles and Celebration of the Underground, featuring Amir Alexander.
 
 
FORWARDandBump n Grindare happy to welcome Amir Alexander to Zeba for his DC Debut. Amir currently lives in Berlin, but is and has been a mainstay and proponent of the Chicago underground house scene for years. As proponents of the underground for over 10 years in DC thinking through our Frankie Knuckles tribute and FORWARDs perspective theme, we couldnt ask for a better figure/guide to help us celebrate Frankies legacy than Amir. Frankie pioneered the underground in Chicago, creating a scene and lifestyle for thousands where the literally wasnt one. He created a refuge for those that walked on the fringe, those that needed a safe place to express themselves emotionally/physically for hours on end. Amir is carrying that torch, carrying that flame and will be showcasing and juxtaposing the Chicago undergrounds legacy and perspective via three turntables for our beloved DC community. Bring your open mind and heart. Wear those shoes and duds that inspire you to move and prepare to shimmy your way across that baby powdered dance floor as we welcomeAmir Alexanderto DC. FREE for FORWARD 2014 Pass holders. FB Event Here

item.title: FORWARD Preview Event: Paradox and Robert Manos at Flash DC
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: There are only a few people in the DnB scene that can claim to hold the title Master of the Drums, one of them is undoubtedly Paradox. Paired up with FORWARD alumn, long time friend and arguably the most unique DnB MC in the game, Robert Manos, April 24th at Flash we are thrilled to partner with our good friends from Cadence who have been curating some unbelievable monthly gatherings for lovers of Drum & Bass. Warm up duties belong to long time area DnB stalwarts Tanc and Tiernan of Dive and Lie Wrecked and Kalu of Dirty City. In honor of Paradox, downstairs will be focused on instrumentals, beats and breaks via selectors Jah Sonic, Nature Rage, Joe L and David. As an official FORWARD Preview event, FORWARD pass holders will get into the event for free. To purchase your pass visit Here See you in the mix!

item.title: FORWARD Preview Event: OMAR S. on 4:20 at Dirty Bar
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Its not Tuesday, but we felt as though you deserved to hear this news on this beautiful Friday morning in DC. As an Official Preview Event for FORWARD 2014, we are pleased to announceLOVE ALWAYS, DETROIT (part one) Featuring OMAR S on Sunday, April 20th at the Dirty Bar Rooftop! Were joining forces with our longtime friends atDEEP SECRETS&NOMADto bring you a Sunday Rooftop party like youve never seen before. Get your presale ticketsHERE This year we take it even deeper than last. Mariana Trench you ask? NO. Center of the god damn earth. On 4:20 we welcome Omar S, a true original and pioneer. His music comes from the soul, and he wears his heart on his sleeve. Theres no bullshit with this man, so come prepared to sweat. This will be our first installment of our Detroit event series, centered around Detroit artists and the people that inspire us.

Sunday April 202014 |2p-11p | Dirty Bar Rooftop

Deep Secrets, Nomad & Forward 2014 Present > LOVE ALWAYS, Detroit (part 1) < Omar S (FXHE, DETROIT) www.soundcloud.com/platform/omar-s-60-min-boiler-room-mix www.omarsdetroit.us/ Chris Burns (Deep Secrets, DC) www.chrisburnsdc.com R&B aka Rosario and Benoit Benoit(Deep Secrets, DC) www.deepsecretsdc.com www.soundcloud.com/benoitbenoit/r-b-live-uhall-june-8-2013 SOUND BY DYNACORD Part of proceeds to benefit Young Detroit Builders(www.youngdetroitbuilders.org/) *ALL FORWARD PASS HOLDERS RECEIVE COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TO EVERY PREVIEW EVENT* Get your FORWARD PassHERE FACEBOOK EVENT PAGE

item.title: Forward DC 2014 Preview: KAHN (Extended Set) @ Tropicalia
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
As an official preview event for FORWARD 2014, we are pleased to announceKAHN(Extended Set),EncryptionB2BRefugee, andJett ChandonThursday, April 17 atTropicalia. Born and raised in the bass Mecca that is Bristol, Kahn is viewed by many as one of the best purveyors of bass oriented music. With releases on labels as diverse as Deep Medi, Idle hands, Punch drunk and Hotline. His cuts span grime, dubstep and dancehall. Hes an artist with a unique ability to tap into the roots of bass as well as lead it into unchartered territory, hence why hes the perfect act to play a rare extended set showcasing his perspective on bass music at this years FORWARD bass preview event. Kahn will be joined by 3 of our favorite local selectors; Encryption, Refugee, and Jett Chandon for what promises to be a great opportunity to experience the kind of vibes you can expect from FORWARD 2014.

Check out this mix Kahn recently laid down for mixmag.

200114th ST NW DC (Lower Level) 21+ | 9PM - 2AM | $10 *FREE with FORWARD 2014 Festival Pass*

item.title: FORWARD 2014 Preview Event: CLOUDWATCH 20th Anniversary Celebration
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: As an official preview event for FORWARD 2014 we are honored to present the 20th Anniversary Celebration of CLOUDWATCH on Saturday May 3rd at Blind Whino a recently rehabilitated Church in SW DC. The all ages event will feature over 15 performing artists, 3 Sound Systems, Visuals, Food Trucks and Bliss. Early Bird Tickets and more information can be purchased here. The event is free for FORWARD pass holders and children under 10. Talent to date, MORE TBA: Original Cloudwatch/Sonic Soul artists -DJ LoveGrove,Infinity,K Ravi(Live), Graham S as well as:Aligning Minds(Live),De Rigueur(Timewarp Records/ Kraak Records NYC), DJ Who,Slant, Pete Welsch (Fatback),Thomas Blondet(Rhythm and Culture Recordings), Adam T Rush, Joe L, A-Deal,Kevin Yost(Live and Improvised Chill Out Set),David,VJ Kaboom(Klip.tv), Capsaicin For those that grew up on the East Coast, CloudWatch was a staple from 1994 - 2000 dedicated to the sounds of ambient, dub, down-tempo, funk, soul, minimal techno, atmospheric drum n bass, experimental electronic, ethnic world influence, and deep house. The event brought all those styles together as the main focus, rather than be relegated to the chill out room. In addition, CloudWatch celebrated the multi-media aspect of underground sub-culture inviting artists to create decor, projections, and an environment that was appealing to all the senses. Heavily influenced by reading about the happenings promoted by the likes of Pink Floyd, Andy Warhol and Velvet Underground, and Ken Keseys Merry Pranksters; they envisioned a modern day take of these art be-ins, and thus was born the concept of CloudWatch. Created by DJs LoveGrove and Bobble featured guests included: Tom Middleton, Mixmaster Morris, Autechre, Pete Lawrence, Kevin Yost, DJ Spooky, Robert Rich, Steve Roach, Spacetime Continuum, Q-Burns Abstract Message, Terre Thaemlitz, Matty Skylab, Thievery Corporation and DJ Wally. FORWARD and the CloudWatch founders are excited to be uniting together to bring this special event back for what promises to be a memorable audio/visual experience, at one of the most unique venues DC has to offer.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: The world is a topsy turvy, complicated and at times very confusing place. Sometimes its hard to stay sane amidst the varying news, opinions and attitudes were bombarded with on a daily basis. As we engage with the world, our friends, families, colleagues and the overall day-to-day we started to appreciate and focus on the importance of Perspective. The importance of maintaining perspective in dealing with people and issues; The power that perspective can gift us in addressing a situation, a problem or in analyzing a result can be the difference maker in coming up with the best solution or realization. To that end, Perspective is the artistic, inspirational theme informing this year's FORWARD 2014.

item.title: Tier One Pass Sales Commence for FORWARD 2014
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
FORWARD is happy to release a limited number of Tier One, $75, Passes for FORWARD 2014.
At FORWARD, we dont believe in VIP. Everyone is a VIP in our book. Having said that, FORWARD pass holders do hold a special place in our heart, as their money helps fuel the vision prior to the event. Pass holders are guaranteed free entry to all official FORWARD 2014 events, including our preview events: 4/11,4/17, 4/24 (yet to be announced), 4/26 (yet to be announced),5/3. Pass holders also receive an official FORWARD 2014T-shirt and other perks yet to be divulged. To purchase your FORWARD 2014 Pass please visit Here

item.title: FORWARD Announces the 2014 Education Series
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: FORWARD is proud to partner with long time DC Area institutionChuck Levins Washington Music Centerin presenting our free education series on Saturday 5/17 and Sunday 5/18 at FORWARD venueTropicaliaon U St. Saturday will feature a Hardware Expo of the latest and greatest production tools. Visitors will get to touch, tweak, experiment with: Roland Aira series, the evolved 808 and 303; Moogs Sub Phatty and Minataur; Dave Smiths Tempest; Korgs Volca Analogue Series; Maschines Studio; Push; Novation Bass Station; Electron gear; a rack of Audio-Technica Headphones and more. This hands on day will also feature Demos, Talks and EXPO only pricing on the above mentioned products. Sunday will continue our tradition of of presenting production workshops featuring everyones favorite production tools including: Ableton and Maschine. We will also present a Pure Data workshop with American University professor William Brent.

item.title: Andy Grant Provides the Fourth Installment to our Perspective Mix Series
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
With UK roots, Andy Grant has been holding down vinyl, house music culture in DC for a while now viaDC House Grooves. He put together a really nice mix for our Perspective Series, that were happy to share with you today. In his own words:
"For the last few weeks Ive been trying to figure out how I would do a mix with the theme 'perspective.' I knew I didnt want to offer up just another mix of the latest dance floor bangers, but apart from that I just didnt have a clue. My process for recording a mix is first to spend a few hours, or even days, listening to records and putting together a pile of 'candidate' records, which may or may not be used. The next step is to find some time to record when I know I will not be disturbed, so I can get behind the decks and take care of business. I never plan a set or a mix; I just put the first record on and see what happens, letting each tune provide the inspiration for the next. For this mix I used a stack of tunes that I had cast aside in previous listening sessions. Most of these were records that hadnt made the cut for previous gigs, mixes and radio shows, but were just begging to be played. I found the right time, hit the record button put a record on and went with the flow. Fortunately the time was right, I got into the zone, and this was the result. Listening to the mix for the first time I couldnt believe these records hadnt made the cut before. Great music is all about perspective, and more often than not the records that stand the test of time are the ones that dont jump out at you at first, the ones that take some time to get into. This mix captures a collection of those records in a unique context, casting them in a new light, providing a new perspective."- Andy Grant

Download Andy Grant: Perspective Mix 004

Track List

1. Reno Wurzbacher The Love You Got (Sven Weisemann Closeness Mix) (Colombage) 2. Levon Vincent These Games (Novel Sounds) 3. Rising Sun Lift Up Your Faces (Svens in Da Face Mix) 4. Blue Base Blue Base (Paper Boys Remix) (Bush) 5. Jeremy Where the Heart Is (Driftwood) 6. Brad P Take U There (Inner Shift Music) 7. Hiver Zefiro (Vidab) 8. Theo Parish Lost Angel (Music Is) 9. Duijn & Douglas Eddies Groove (Aybees Re:shuffle) (Feelharmonic) 10. Vakula Fifth Experiment (Bandura) 11. BLM Range Mod (Contrast Wax) 12. Move D Happylock (Endless Flight) 13. Levon Vincent Deeper (Novel Sounds) 14. DJ Sprinkles Midtown 120 Blues (Endless Flight) 15. Tuccillo Introduciendo (Holic Trax) 16. Jacques Renault - The Fake Out (Lets Play House) 17. Quarion Run That Shit (Guilty Pleasure #3)(Munk) 18. Genius of Time Tight Genes (Aniara Recordings) 19. Kevin Griffiths Enjoy the Bozak (Tsuba) 20. Frits Wentink Fluffy Tit (Wolfskuil Ltd) 21. Baunz feat. 3rd Eye Out of the Window (Walker & Royce Remix) 22. Monsieur Cedric - Bonus Track 1 (Extended Mix)

item.title: FORWARD 2014 Artist Announcement : Mr. Saturday Night
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded: FORWARD 2014 is inspired by Perspective. One way that will be manifesting itself in our programming is through nights that focus on a particular artist or label. Allowing them the opportunity to share with the FORWARD community, their perspective on sound/aesthetic/energy - a party. The first entity were excited to share with you that will be featured at FORWARD 2014 is Justin Carter and Eamon Harkin ofMr. Saturday Night. The first time we met Justin and Eamon was quite a few years back. We had hosted Kyle Hall on Saturday night here (his 18th birthday) in DC and they were hosting him at their infamous outdoor Sunday party at Gowanus Grove aka BKLYN Yard. What a party. The global dance community was there shaking their tail feather, having a chat, train spotting, taking in the scene and energy. White, Black, Thick, Thin, Hip, Weird, Gay, Straightjust the way we like it. Since then, the guys were featured heavily in Resident AdvisorsReal Scenes NYC(as well as label mates and FORWARD alumn Archie Pelago) - have gone on to tour the world and start a record label while still holding down their regularno BS,mission drivenDIY events. Were thrilled to be bringing our NY bretheren and the Mr. Saturday Night vibe to our beloved FORWARD community for their DC Debut.
